page.title: 01Pimperne.
page.content: Pimperne is a village in Dorset, fifteen miles from the South coast. The nearest big towns Bournemouth, Salisbury and Dorchester are all about twenty miles away. Pimperne is three miles north of Blandford Forum on the A354 road to Salisbury.Nearby is Blandford Camp. Pimperne is about 200 feet obove sea level.Most of the land around is farm land,crops,mainly corn,with some grazing for friesian cattle,sheep and pigs.The soil is light,chalky with a lot of flint. Pimperne was mentioned in the first Domesday Book and is also famous for its long barrow, thought to be 4,000 years old and the lron Age Pimperne Round House a replica of which can be found at Butser Hill near Petersfield.The name Pimperne is said to come from the Celtic "pimp prem" meaning five trees.
